content: A train travels at an average speed of 80 kilometers per hour. How long will it take to cover a distance of 400 kilometers?

To find out how long it will take for the train to cover a distance of 400 kilometers at an average speed of 80 kilometers per hour, we can use the formula for time, which is:

\[ \text{time} = \frac{\text{distance}}{\text{speed}} \]

Plugging in the given values:

\[ \text{time} = \frac{400 \, \text{km}}{80 \, \text{km/h}} \]

\[ \text{time} = 5 \, \text{hours} \]

So, it will take the train 5 hours to cover the distance of 400 kilometers at an average speed of 80 kilometers per hour.
